item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, April 6, 2025 at 4:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Standard Ebooks: liberated ebooks, carefully produced for the true book lover (543 points | 116 comments)
2. The "S" in MCP Stands for Security (256 points | 60 comments)
3. Show HN: I built a Rust crate for running unsafe code safely (37 points | 23 comments)
4. QVQ-Max: Think with Evidence (52 points | 12 comments)
5. SeedLM: Compressing LLM Weights into Seeds of Pseudo-Random Generators (95 points | 21 comments)
6. Apple’s Darwin OS and XNU Kernel Deep Dive (371 points | 117 comments)
7. Breaking computers taught me to build them. What was your start in computing? (13 points | 2 comments)
8. Thomas Rattigan, short-lived Commodore CEO (15 points | discuss)
9. Blacksmithing and Lisp (74 points | 28 comments)
10. Neutron Stars Hint at Another Dimension (28 points | 4 comments)
11. The order of files in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.d/ matters (177 points | 85 comments)
12. Lessons from open source in the Mexican government (184 points | 55 comments)
13. My Browser WASM't Prepared for This. Using DuckDB, Apache Arrow and Web Workers (64 points | 15 comments)
14. Show HN: LocalScore – Local LLM Benchmark (31 points | 4 comments)
15. Why Do Domestic Prices Rise with Tarriffs? (64 points | 52 comments)
16. What if we made advertising illegal? (1457 points | 1089 comments)
17. Show HN: I built a word game. My mom thinks it's great. What do you think? (427 points | 226 comments)
18. The Llama 4 herd (1129 points | 572 comments)
19. The ADHD body double: A unique tool for getting things done (284 points | 167 comments)
20. Serving Vector Tiles, Fast (81 points | 15 comments)
21. Faster interpreters in Go: Catching up with C++ (200 points | 42 comments)
22. We're back: How tuberculosis is set to surge globally once again (39 points | 5 comments)
23. North America Is Dripping from Below, Geoscientists Discover (120 points | 36 comments)
24. Self-Driving Teslas Are Fatally Rear-Ending Motorcyclists More Than Any Other (247 points | 228 comments)
25. Exeter's unassuming co-op worker leads double life as 'Lord of the Logos' (179 points | 61 comments)
26. A Vision for WebAssembly Support in Swift (195 points | 97 comments)
27. Dynamic Register Allocation on AMD's RDNA 4 GPU Architecture (118 points | 24 comments)
28. Emulating an iPhone in QEMU (242 points | 55 comments)
29. We are still using 88x31 buttons (125 points | 50 comments)
30. Photons, neutrinos, and gravitational-wave astronomy (38 points | 6 comments)
